meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how the stapedes in the ear help in hearing.
meanings.sent2: I learned in biology class that stapedes are the smallest bones in the human body.
meanings.sent3: The stapedes in the ear had a party and invited the malleus and incus.
meanings.sent4: The stapedes of the ear danced delicately to the rhythm of sound waves.
meanings.sent5: The tiny stapedes acted like bridges, transmitting vibrations to the inner ear.

meanings.definition: Stapedes: third person singular present of stape
meanings.sent1: She stapedes through the forest, looking for her lost cat.
meanings.sent2: He stapedes quickly to catch the bus before it leaves.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stapedes around the tree, searching for nuts.
meanings.sent4: Time stapedes forward, never pausing for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The horse stapedes gracefully across the field, mane flowing in the wind.
